gurmukhi: ਓਰੜ ਫੳੁਜਾਂ ਅਾੲੀਅਾਂ; ਬੀਰ ਚੜੇ ਕੰਧਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Orad Faujaan Aaeeaan Beer Chade Kandhdaree||
translation: The forces came in great numbers and the ranks of warriors marched forward
They pulled their sharp swords from their scabbards.

gurmukhi: ਕੜਕ ੳੁਠੇ ਰਣ ਮੱਚਿਅਾ; ਵੱਡੇ ਹੰਕਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Kadak Outhe Ran Machchiaa Vadde Hankdaree||
translation: With the blazing of the war, the great egoist warriors shouted loudly.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ਧੜ ਬਾਹਾਂ ਗਨਲੇ; ਫੁਲ ਜੇਹੈ ਬਾੜੀ ॥
transliteration: Sir Dhad Baahaan Gad Le Phul Jehai Baadee||
translation: The pieces of head, trunk and arms look like garden-flowers.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਪੇ ਕਟੇ ਬਾਢੀਅਾਂ; ਰੁਖ ਚੰਦਨਿ ਅਾਰੀ ॥੪੮॥
transliteration: Jaape Kate Baadheeaan Roukh Channdan Daree||48||
translation: And (the bodies) appear like the trees of sandalwood cut and sawed by the carpenters.48.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਹਾਂ ਕੰਧਾਰਾਂ ਮੁਹਿ ਜੁੜੇ; ਜਾ ਸੱਟ ਪੲੀ ਖਰਵਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Duhaan Kandhaaraan Muh(i) Jude Jaa Satt Paikharvaar Kau||
translation: When the trumpet, enveloped by the hide of a donkey, was beaten, both the forces faced each other.

gurmukhi: ਤਕ ਤਕ ਕੈਬਰਿ ਦੁਰਗਸਾਹ; ਤਕ ਮਾਰੇ ਭਲੇ ਜੁਝਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Tak Tak Kaibar(i) Durgsaah Tak Mdare Bhale Jujhaar Kau||
translation: Looking at the warriors, Durga pointedly shot her arrows on the brave fighters.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਦਲ ਮਾਰੇ ਹਾਥੀਅਾਂ; ਸੰਗ ਰਥ ਗਿਰੇ ਅਸਵਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Paidal Mdare Haatheeaan San(i) Rath Gire Asvaar Kau||
translation: The warriors on foot were killed, the elephants were killed alongwith the fall of the chariots and horse- riders.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਹਨ ਸੰਜਾ ਬਾਗੜਾ; ਜਣੁ ਲੱਗੇ ਫੁੱਲ ਅਨਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Sohan Sanjaa Baagadaa Jan(u) Lagge Phull Anaar Kau||
translation: The tips of arrows penetrated in the armour like the flowers on pomegranate-plants.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੱਸੇ ਅਾੲੀ ਕਾਲਕਾ; ਹਥਿ ਸੱਜੇ ਲੈ ਤਰਵਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Gousse Aaikaalkaadhath(i) Sajje Lai Talvaar Kau||
translation: The goddess Kali got enraged, holding her sword in her right hand;

gurmukhi: ੲੇਦੂੰ ਪਾਰੳੁ ਓਤ ਪਾਰ; ਹਰਿਨਾਕਸਿ ਕੲੀ ਹਜਾਰ ਕੱੳੁ ॥
transliteration: Edoo Paarau Ot Paar Harnaakas(i) Kaihajaar Kau||
translation: She destroyed several thousand demons (Hiranayakashipus) from this end of the field to the other end.
The only one is conquering the army;
O goddess! Hail, hail to Thy blow.49.
